issue.title: Usernames removed from message using /me
issue.body:
### Description:

When writing a message starting with `/me`, any usernames will be removed from this message when rendering it.

### Environment Information:

- Rocket.Chat Server Version: 6.4.3
- Rocket.Chat App Version: 4.42.0.50842
- Device Name: ELE-L29 (Huawei P30)
- OS Version: EMUI 12.0.0 (Android 11)

### Steps to reproduce:

1. Write a message using the `/me` command highlighting any user.

### Expected behavior:

The message will be rendered containing the username. The browser version of Rocket.Chat works like this:

![image](https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/404840/4b3a446d-7c85-49b4-9af0-8ebb903ff65d)

### Actual behavior:

The message will be rendered without the username:

https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/404840/d7594b2f-99e3-4a6a-af99-9e4d886631cd

issue.title: User suggestions not available when using a slash command
issue.body:
### Description:

When composing a message, no usernames will be suggested when starting the message with a slash command.

### Environment Information:

- Rocket.Chat Server Version: 6.4.3
- Rocket.Chat App Version: 4.42.0.50842
- Device Name: ELE-L29 (Huawei P30)
- OS Version: EMUI 12.0.0 (Android 11)

### Steps to reproduce:

1. Start composing a message with a slash command, like `/me`, `/shrug` etc.
2. After a space, type `@` and wait for username suggestions to appear.

### Expected behavior:

Username suggestions are shown.

### Actual behavior:

No usernames are suggested.

https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/404840/f0c46945-54ad-45c6-aa30-dbc9644f26b4

### Additional context:

In the browser version of Rocket.Chat, this works as expected.

issue.title: Using /me when quoting a message creates a reply
issue.body:
### Description:

When quoting a message and starting the text with `/me`, a reply will be created instead of a message including a quote.

### Environment Information:

- Rocket.Chat Server Version: 6.4.3
- Rocket.Chat App Version: 4.42.0.50842
- Device Name: ELE-L29 (Huawei P30)
- OS Version: EMUI 12.0.0 (Android 11)

### Steps to reproduce:

1. Write a message.
2. Write a second message quoting the first one. Start the text of this message with `/me`.

### Expected behavior:

In step 2, a message is created including a quote containing the message from step 1.

### Actual behavior:

The message from step 2 becomes a reply to the message from step 1.

https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/404840/25d8909c-43a8-4f49-bff5-2e190a120bfb

issue.title: :p rendered as custom emoji :p: in quote
issue.body:
### Description:

If a custom emoji with the name `p` is configured, `:p` will be rendered as custom emoji in quotes.

### Environment Information:

- Rocket.Chat Server Version: 6.4.3
- Rocket.Chat App Version: 4.42.0.50842
- Device Name: ELE-L29 (Huawei P30)
- OS Version: EMUI 12.0.0 (Android 11)

### Steps to reproduce:

1. Configure a custom emoji with name `p`.
2. Write a message containing `:p`. No emoji should be rendered in this message as for the custom emoji `:p:` must be used.
3. Write a second message quoting the first one.

### Expected behavior:

In the quote in the second message, no emoji is rendered.

### Actual behavior:

![Screenshot_20231027_005302](https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/404840/54a8e8b6-84cc-4f73-b9f3-6735225d1dae)

### Additional context:

I tried the same steps as above, but using the emoji name `a` instead of `p`. That way I was unable to reproduce the issue.

The extremely beautiful image I uploaded as custom emoji is this one: ![p](https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/404840/9cea4918-14e3-47aa-a266-3af26a847394)

pull_request.title: feat: new audio player
pull_request.body:
<!-- This is a pull request template, you do not need to uncomment or remove the comments, they won't show up in the PR text. -->

## Proposed changes
<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below. -->
This PR is improving the Audio Player. The main reason was to change the layout and add the capability to increase/decrease the audio's velocity (rate).

Beyond the layout stuff, I changed how we handle the audio. Also, I refactor the approach implemented in that PR https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/pull/4662 to avoid the necessity of EventListener. Added to this new approach, we are able to control and unload the audio from other places besides the RoomView and the Component Audio, this could be discussed later.

## Issue(s)	
<!-- Link the issues being closed by or related to this PR. For example, you can use #594 if this PR closes issue number 594 -->

## How to test or reproduce
<!-- Mention how you would reproduce the bug if not mentioned on the issue page already. Also mention which screens are going to have the changes if applicable -->
- Send multiple audios in a single channel to test the play/pause/rate
- Send audio in a thread 
    - The audio from a channel will pause when opening the thread
    - If the audio from a thread is playing, then back to the channel, this audio from the thread should stop
 - Background listening
 - Check if screen is always on while playing an audio and if can go off after is paused
 - Play the audio from all clients origin on all clients Android/iOS/Web.

## Screenshots


https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/47038980/5b139486-728c-4078-8f87-3ee0fe3aca22


https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/47038980/01fdc54b-d7a5-461a-8cd1-e28e9b3f5855



https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/47038980/d49c9fe7-0cb1-48de-bdca-6366963325e9


#### With Sound
https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/47038980/cdd0cd6f-c966-49fb-a6b1-99205ad7999a



## Types of changes
<!-- What types of changes does your code introduce to Rocket.Chat? -->
<!-- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply -->

- [ ] Bugfix (non-breaking change which fixes an issue)
- [x] Improvement (non-breaking change which improves a current function)
- [ ] New feature (non-breaking change which adds functionality)
- [ ] Documentation update (if none of the other choices apply)

## Checklist
<!-- Put an `x` in the boxes that apply. You can also fill these out after creating the PR. If you're unsure about any of them, don't hesitate to ask. We're here to help! This is simply a reminder of what we are going to look for before merging your code. -->

- [x] I have read the [CONTRIBUTING](https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat/blob/develop/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#contributing-to-rocketchat) doc
- [x] I have signed the [CLA](https://cla-assistant.io/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative)
- [x] Lint and unit tests pass locally with my changes
- [ ] I have added tests that prove my fix is effective or that my feature works (if applicable)
- [ ] I have added necessary documentation (if applicable)

pull_request.title: feat (Android): mobile ringer
pull_request.body:
<!-- This is a pull request template, you do not need to uncomment or remove the comments, they won't show up in the PR text. -->

## Proposed changes
<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below. -->
This PR enables accepting and refusing conf video calls on Android.
When a call is initiated on the web or on another device, the user will receive a push, which will play the receiving music and have accept or decline buttons.
When you accept, he will go straight to the room and join the call.
When he rejects it, he goes to the room, but he will have rejected the call.

## Issue(s)	
<!-- Link the issues being closed by or related to this PR. For example, you can use #594 if this PR closes issue number 594 -->

## How to test or reproduce
<!-- Mention how you would reproduce the bug if not mentioned on the issue page already. Also mention which screens are going to have the changes if applicable -->
Initiate a web or mobile call to the user logged in to the device and try to accept or decline the call.

comment.body: I added some commits to `feat.new-audio-player-2` branch. You can cherry pick them.

I understand why 0.5 is last on this array, but you could pretty much set it as first index and use default index 1.
If we ever need to change the layout and show all of them the way it is, we'll need to refactor sort this array to display it as first value.

![Oct-25-2023 16-29-41](https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/804994/a14e20ab-0df4-424b-9943-a27585d27871)

Seek has two main UI issues:
- It triggers the opacity of the whole component. We're RN devs, so we know what to expect from a TouchableOpacity, but not users. Might be fixed if you use gesture handler.
- It opens action sheet if I don't move it enough, or fast enough. On my video, I'm moving my mouse slowly trying to find the spot. Think of a podcast-like kind of audio message, where a minimal seek moves 20 seconds.

pull_request.body:
<!-- This is a pull request template, you do not need to uncomment or remove the comments, they won't show up in the PR text. -->

## Proposed changes
<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below. -->
This PR is improving the Audio Player. The main reason was to change the layout and add the capability to increase/decrease the audio's velocity (rate).

Beyond the layout stuff, I changed how we handle the audio. Also, I refactor the approach implemented in that PR https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/pull/4662 to avoid the necessity of EventListener. Added to this new approach, we are able to control and unload the audio from other places besides the RoomView and the Component Audio, this could be discussed later.

## Issue(s)	
<!-- Link the issues being closed by or related to this PR. For example, you can use #594 if this PR closes issue number 594 -->

## How to test or reproduce
<!-- Mention how you would reproduce the bug if not mentioned on the issue page already. Also mention which screens are going to have the changes if applicable -->
- Send multiple audios in a single channel to test the play/pause/rate
- Send audio in a thread 
    - The audio from a channel will pause when opening the thread
    - If the audio from a thread is playing, then back to the channel, this audio from the thread should stop
 - Background listening
 - Check if screen is always on while playing an audio and if can go off after is paused
 - Play the audio from all clients origin on all clients Android/iOS/Web.

They should be a unified state.

comment.body:
This is a Play button and it contains 3 states: loading, playing, paused.
It receives 3 props (loading, paused, isReadyToPlay) where it could be 1: status.

This way a button with an icon only knows what it should display and it's self contained.

pull_request.title: feat: new audio player
pull_request.body:
<!-- This is a pull request template, you do not need to uncomment or remove the comments, they won't show up in the PR text. -->

## Proposed changes
<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below. -->
This PR is improving the Audio Player. The main reason was to change the layout and add the capability to increase/decrease the audio's velocity (rate).

Beyond the layout stuff, I changed how we handle the audio. Also, I refactor the approach implemented in that PR https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/pull/4662 to avoid the necessity of EventListener. Added to this new approach, we are able to control and unload the audio from other places besides the RoomView and the Component Audio, this could be discussed later.

<!-- Link the issues being closed by or related to this PR. For example, you can use #594 if this PR closes issue number 594 -->

<!-- Mention how you would reproduce the bug if not mentioned on the issue page already. Also mention which screens are going to have the changes if applicable -->
- Send multiple audios in a single channel to test the play/pause/rate
- Send audio in a thread 
    - The audio from a channel will pause when opening the thread
    - If the audio from a thread is playing, then back to the channel, this audio from the thread should stop
 - Background listening
 - Check if screen is always on while playing an audio and if can go off after is paused
 - Play the audio from all clients origin on all clients Android/iOS/Web.

pull_request.title: feat: capability to enable/disable writing in rooms read only
pull_request.body:
<!-- This is a pull request template, you do not need to uncomment or remove the comments, they won't show up in the PR text. -->

## Proposed changes
<!-- Describe the big picture of your changes here to communicate to the maintainers why we should accept this pull request. If it fixes a bug or resolves a feature request, be sure to link to that issue below. -->

I was working on this task that seemed straightforward at first: relabeling buttons. However, during the tests, we discovered that the 'unmuted' array handling for read-only rooms wasn't functioning correctly on mobile. Surprisingly, the 'unmuted' array wasn't even being saved in the local database. To fix this, we needed more than just label changes. We had to modify the database to handle the 'unmuted' array in the local database.

## Issue(s)	
<!-- Link the issues being closed by or related to this PR. For example, you can use #594 if this PR closes issue number 594 -->

## How to test or reproduce
<!-- Mention how you would reproduce the bug if not mentioned on the issue page already. Also mention which screens are going to have the changes if applicable -->

- Create a read-only channel and add one or a few users
- unmute users  and try to send a message using them
- then mute again and these users wouldn't be able to send a message again.
- Also check the labels if they are the same as expected by the design

## Screenshots

- At Desktop app, the user logged is the Reinaldo Neto. While on mobile is reinaldo123

https://github.com/RocketChat/Rocket.Chat.ReactNative/assets/47038980/3bfab004-665b-4568-9aa2-3a72aa28fbdf
